title: Never Modern - serif FONT id
content:
Looking for a font ID on this elegant serif font.

Many thanks in advance,  
Danny

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459im_/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_ni52vdw24L1qhzd1do1_1280_4597.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [tumblr\_ni52vdw24L1qhzd1do1\_1280.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459/http:/typophile.com/files/tumblr_ni52vdw24L1qhzd1do1_1280.jpg) | 62.6 KB |
author: Danny_Miller

comments.content:
Agree. Note that the serifs are edited to make a Times with Latin, i.e. triangular, serifs.  
Don

I believe it’s based on [Starling](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/Starling/).

Starling is used in the book.  
 [http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/project/never\_modern](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459/http:/www.morganstudio.co.uk/project/never_modern "http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/project/never\_modern")  
Have a look at this italic on this image:  
 [http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/img/projects/1788/f/jms\_3463.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459/http:/www.morganstudio.co.uk/img/projects/1788/f/jms_3463.jpg "http://www.morganstudio.co.uk/img/projects/1788/f/jms\_3463.jpg")

I had thought Times Roman. But a direct comparison of Starling Roman -- top sample -- and Times Roman

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150125013459im_/http:/typophile.com/files/StartlingRomanVsTimesRoman_5370.jpg)
  
reveals that Starling Roman is a better match. Slightly wider lower case and easy to spot differences like the terminal on \_r\_.  
The serifs are modified to Latin/triangular versions.  
Don
